Reviews.Title: “Great place, will come back”
Reviews.Author: TBO2000
Reviews.Content: Was looking for a hotel near city center with parking and for a good price. We had all this and more, good price because had a great deal, nice room with big LCD screen. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful and using the shuttle you're in no time in the city center.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, a short free shuttle ride from the centre!”
Reviews.Author: MissyP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is only a 10 min (free) shuttle ride from their sister hotel The NH Barbizon (which is across the road from Central Station). The hotel itself was clean and very comfortable. The rooms were bright, clean and comfortable with aircon, a fridge for snacks and drinks and a huge superkingsize bed! The hotel also offers free DVD rental for your room and free 15 min PC use. PS...If you feel peckish late at night! I would thoroughly recommend 'Mesir Doner', a clean, friendly, bright little cafe across the road, open late and serving the most amazing Kebabs and Pizzas!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly staff, helpful to fix problems. Free bus to centre”
Reviews.Author: tallandrew
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel after booking on easytobook.com. When we arrived, the hotel couldn't find any record of our reservation. Easytobook.com had taken the order but not passed it onto the hotel. Immediately, the lady on the desk told me what had happened, said that they would try to get to the bottom of it, and assured me that there would be somewhere to stay for us. A few minutes later she had sorted it out (by ringing head office and logging into easytobook's computers to find our records) and she upgraded us to a king size room, and even threw in a balloon for our toddler. Overall, the staff here were the friendliest and most helpful we have come across in any hotel. The outside of the hotel looks a bit drab, but the inside is lovely. The king size room was very large with a massive bathroom, all stylishly decorated in contemporary decor. There was a TV with some english channels in the room. The bed was super comfortable. Shower good. They provided a cot for our toddler too. There is a restaurant and bar but we didn't use them. The hotel is slightly out of the centre but there are two ways to get there. 1. Take the free shuttle bus which goes from the hotel entrance to the NH Brabizon hotel opposite the railway station downtown. It is 10 minutes ride and the bus goes from 10am to 11.45pm (i think). 2. Walk 15-20 minutes to the river and pick up the free water taxi that takes you across to the centre. We opted for the bus. There is a market just across the road from the hotel on Wednesday mornings. Features that we found great: Free parking for guests Free shuttle bus every 15 mins (10 mins ride) to Town Centre. Breakfast is available if required: 19 euros pp. We didn't have it Free Wifi in lobby Beautiful modern interior design. Very spacious We have no complaints at all with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome customer service, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: flymom2
Reviews.Content: The N H Galaxy is a very nice hotel that is tucked away just a few miles from the downtown Amsterdam area. The staff is very friendly and helpful. They offer complimentary shuttle service into the city that drops off in front of the N H Barbazon. The drop off point is an excellent location to walk to various restaurants and all other activities that may be on your list of things to do such as tours. The rooms are very clean and very modern. They have a mini fridge in each room too. My family of four had a short stay here. We had two rooms with double beds each. The double beds are pushed together and appear a king bed, but the sheets are made up on each one as separate. It worked out fine. We would definitely stay here again! They gave a great room rate.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel but priceworthy!”
Reviews.Author: Marco_Cate
Reviews.Content: we stayed 3 nights. even if the hotel is not directly in the center the internal shuttle is very efficient and frequent. Tidy rooms. A very priceworthy solution!

Reviews.Title: “Brill hotel.”
Reviews.Author: joshy-boo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 4 3 nites in nov. we were to stay in movenpick but thanks to easy2 book we arrived 2 find we had no reservation. found this hotel & werent we glad. fab place. we were celebrating our 1st wedding anniversary, & were upgraded to a suite with wonderful views. staff very friendly & we also got complimentary drinks sent 2 our room. The hotel isnt central but a courtesy bus leaves every 20 mins, drop of at central station. What more cud u want????? Would def stay here again and would recommend to others. Thanks for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff----Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: MichaelMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: The recent remodel served this hotel very well. The decor and color scheme of the rooms are well thought out. I like the rooms in the tower My room was huge this time, however I have had smaller rooms before. Never get a smoking room (even if you smoke) they smell really bad. I like to go for a walk and catch the FREE water taxi to Central Station and wonder around Dam Square. It is nice after a busy day of sight seeing to come to a quiet part of town. The staff is ALWAYS very friendly and helpful. There are bikes you can rent from the hotel (however get your request in early on a nice day). I also like to go to the Nearby Albert Heine grocery store and stock up on great cheese. There are many ethnic choices for food near the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Most Airline Crews”
Reviews.Author: FlyGirlH61
Reviews.Content: Just an FYI on this hotel.........I fly for a major US airline. This is mainly a crew hotel. If you're looking for something closer in or a more local feel, I would probably steer away from this one. There are several quaint cafes and shops nearby, but unless you've stayed there many times, you would think you were out in the middle of nowhere.

Reviews.Title: “Mis-sold as a secret hotel on lastminute.com - this hotel is no where near the local attractions”
Reviews.Author: lickshot_1000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was one of the secret hotels listed in last minute.com. This is the description mentioned: "â€¢ Fantastic hotel near the attractions of Amsterdam - 4* - Amsterdam Local Attractions â€¢ Flower Market â€¢ Rijksmuseum â€¢ Anne Frank House â€¢ Van Gogh-Museum â€¢ Dam Square Location â€¢ Nearest airport: Amsterdam â€¢ Nearest train station: Amsterdam Central Station This fantastic hotel offers all the necessary facilities to make your stay a fantastic trip in Amsterdam, both for leisure or business guests! The hotel offers stylish, modern sleeping rooms, a restaurant and a parking lot. All the rooms are equipped with air conditioning and television. Amsterdam city centre is within easy reach by different ways of public transport.â€� After booking, we found out it was the NH Galaxy... We were both very disappointed with the location of the hotel; it stated that it was near the local attractions. The hotel is actually outside of the city, across the river on the north of Amsterdam. I would state that this is NOT near the local attractions. Now compare the above description with the one they use when not under a secret hotel guise: â€œNH Galaxy is situated just north of Amsterdam's city centre. The hotel has 290 comfortable rooms, fitness centre and it's own parking offering 150 spaces. There is also a daily bus shuttle service into the city centre from the hotel, where you can visit the the house of Anne Frank, the Red Light District or the main shopping streets of Amsterdam. Other tourist attactions like Marken, Edam and Volendam are just a 15 minute drive from the hotelâ€� I let you make your own judgement, but if your thinking about saving money (considering taxis etc) and enjoying Amsterdam at a leisurely pace â€“ avoid this hotel, the location is terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean hotel with great service”
Reviews.Author: sorentn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel in matter of business. I've been to a lot of hotels lately and this is one of the better. The hotel doesnt look very attractive from the outside, but when you come to the inside everything changes. It looks and smells like it recently has been refurbished. The room was great, and clean, nice bed. WIFI was running smootly, and breakfast was great. If you want to go the the center, there is a free shuttle bus, taking to the NH Barbizon just in the middel of Amsterdam. The drive is 10 mins. And it runs every 15 mns untill midningt. Great service. I've nothing to compalin about what so ever

Reviews.Title: “It's affordable”
Reviews.Author: escube_studio
Reviews.Content: At the price it's a great hotel....really value for money !! It's really clean & nice

Reviews.Title: “The worst "4 star" hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: davejjk
Reviews.Content: On my last trip to Amsterdam my wife and I first stayed in the Golden Tulip Amsterdam Art (which was beautiful) we then booked a further 3 days in the Dam via Lastminute.com's Top Secret Hotels (you get a brief description of the hotel but not the name of it until you book it). The hotel was described as being 2km north of the city centre with a free bus shuttle service to the centre and it was described as a 4 star hotel. Since it was only about Â£210 for 3 nights (top secret hotels are discounted) we thought we'd got ourselves a great deal...until we arrived. Our first impressions of the hotel building when we arrived was that it looked drab and unimpressive from the outside. Once inside, the reception and lounge looked more like what I'd expect from a 4 star hotel, clean, spacious and reasonably modern. After checking in with one of the receptionists (who, like most Amsterdammers, spoke perfect English) we headed off to our room. As soon as the lift doors opened, a powerful, musty smell hit us (if you've ever opened a cupboard full of clothes thats been shut for months, you'll know the smell). When we reached our room, the same smell was waiting for us as was an extremely dated decor and furniture. Whilst I don't know the hotel's history, the smell alone convinced me that it had probably been shut for some time before our stay, though why it wasn't possible for the staff to clean the place or at least air it out properly is beyond me. The biggest shock I had was the state of the bathroom. The ceiling was covered in dirty brown tidemarks which suggested that upstairs had flooded at some point in the past. The sink was covered in cigarette burns and the hairdryer that was fixed to the wall had turned a yellow/brown colour from age. There was also a cheap looking paper lampshade in the bedroom which had a huge tear in it, again, why couldn't the staff replace or remove this before our stay??? At this point, I reflected that if this hotel had been advertised as 1 or 2 star or if it had been incredibly cheap, I would have been feeling really depressed that I couldn't afford better. As it was. I just felt angry at being ripped off. In need of a beer, I opened the minibar to be confronted by an empty fridge. I rang reception to let them know the minibar was empty but they informed me it was supposed to be empty! After fruitlessly looking for a room service menu, I rang them to order a salad and ask if they could bring up a menu while they were at it, they told me they had no menus! Incidentally, I really couldn't fault the food we had, however, if you've been to the Dam before, you'll know that they take good food seriously. The next morning I walked into the bathroom to discover the reason for the tidemarks on the ceiling. There was a small but steady drip coming from the ceiling which had left the floor soaking wet. I rang reception to let them know, genuinely thinking that someone may have flooded their bathroom above us. The manager arrived and told me he'd investigate the problem and warned me that we may have to change rooms. This wasn't a problem as any other room woul;d have been an improvement on the one we were in. After waiting for 2 hours for him to come back we got fed up and decided to head to the city centre (he never returned throughout our stay, the drip kept dripping and we never changed rooms). Next disapointment for us was discovering that the free bus service to the city centre was non-existent (though it did apparently run in the past). This infuriated me as the sole reason we chose this hotel over another similar hotel advertised on Lastminute was the free shuttle service which could have saved us at least a hundred euros on taxis and buses. This is quite simply false advertising and at worst, obtaining money by deception! On a similar note, the hotel was advertised as having tea/coffee making facilities, needless to say, this was another lie. Would I return to this hotel? Never. Would I recommend this hotel to anybody? Not if I liked them. If you are reading this review, considering staying at this hotel, I urge you to look elsewhere or be as disappointed as my wife and I were.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Hotel”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere46
Reviews.Content: Do not stay here! Rooms dirty, noisy, and the neighborhood is not welcoming to foreigners! It is NOT near the Central Station! You must walk 15 minutes and take the ferry or be subject to the disgruntled van service. Ongoing construction means noise problems for some time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ray96
Reviews.Content: It's true the building is terrible and the rooms are a little bit old. BUT the staff and the service is GREAT!!!!! They will do everything they can for you, and their creating new rooms now!!! The free shuttle bus is a great exelent service!!! I recommend this hotel to everyone!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: anna73Greece
Reviews.Content: nice hotel with a free shuttle to take you to town. food was ok, but the breakfast was really expensive. nice room and clean. the hotel is expensive, but so are almost all amsterdam hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Comfort & Price”
Reviews.Author: renegadeLondon
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel quite often whilst on my trips and connecting journeys to Amsterdam. The hotel's location is a bit out of the main tourist areas but is served well efficiently, to & from the hotel with the 15 minutes shuttle leaving from NH Barbizon Palace, opposite Centraal Station. The rooms are of high standards with all the amenities you would expect from a 4 star rated property despite it actually having an official 3 stars. It deserves better. Bathrooms are very clean and more than well equipped. Constantly the toileteries' selection is more generous than most other hotel companies I have stayed with. TV with few English and European Channels are avaialble in the rooms. Beds are very comfortable. The check-in staff are polite and helpful and they do actually try to remember that you stayed here before! Also I get to meet the Northwest Airlines Flight-crew in the mornings, everytime when I am checking out and they are leaving for Schiphol for their flight. Overall a highly recommended hotel for an extremely reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “4* NH Central Station”
Reviews.Author: audreyg
Reviews.Content: We just spent a night in this hotel and it deserves a higher ranking! First it is true that the hotel is about 10min by car from the central station and the building looks terrible from the outside (used to be an old hospital). But it is a 4* hotel (by international standards) and is is MUCH better then any hotel you can find in the city centre in that price range. We payed 84,-â‚¬ per room (parking =free) and 12,5â‚¬ for breakfast wich was really very nice. The hotel is used by the staff of North West Airlines (they get better prices!!). The rooms are very nice and the beds very comfortable. The shuttle bus works excellent. It goes every 20min to the NH Barbizon (much more expensive) across the central station (near the red light district). The last bus from the centre to the hotel leaves at 02:45am!! I really do not understand all the negative comments. It is an excellent hotel at an excellent price!

Reviews.Title: “In a galaxy far far far away....”
Reviews.Author: F_R_Lang
Reviews.Content: They decided to call this the "Central Station". They could have called it the "Outer Mongolia" as it is just a name after all. It might change your expectation of where the hotel might be but the reality is it is nowhere near central or indeed a station, so it would be just as accurate. Rooms are adequate, just not quite what you expect in an NH hotel, everything is there but just feels a little more downmarket. Empty mini bar fridge, Wi Fi internet access, not a biscuit with the kettle in room, that type of thing. breakfast needs to be booked in advance for â‚¬12 price, but the hotel do not have any vouchers or indeed alternatives when required. If you need to get anywhere early or late you need a taxi as the complimentary bus only makes scheduled trips from 4-10pm. Taxis cost between 12-18 euros depending on which taxi mafia you pick up. All told, better pay a few euros for a nearer and better hotel unless you have business on the newer north side area.

Reviews.Title: “name of hotel is a con!”
Reviews.Author: flomc
Reviews.Content: the name of this hotel is a con! its called central station and is no where near it! although the hotel offers a free shuttle bus. you spend most of your time waiting on it. when we first arrived in amsterdam we had no clue where to get this free shuttle bus and no one else knew where to direct us to it! when we finally found where to get it we were waitin 40 mins in the ICE cold! (not a good start) The hotel room is very basic and not the cleanest think they need to invest in new carpet! **keep your shoes on** had a nice toiletry set for men and women but that dont make up for the cheap perfume smell comin from the cupboard!! ( i think a prozzie was livin in it haha) overall hotel was alright but would stay somewhere a bit more central. wastes alot of time waitin about!

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near Central Station!”
Reviews.Author: JonnyLux
Reviews.Content: WARNING! - This hotel is absolutely nowhere NEAR Amsterdam Central Station. It's not even close. Admittedly, a shuttle bus does run free of charge to the centre, but visit on days of low demand (as I did) and you'll be waiting around for a while. Otherwise, it's just a typical business hotel. The rooms are bland, the food is poor, the drinks are expensive and the breakfast really wasn't up to scratch at all. But it's relatively comfortable and thoroughly inoffensive. Stay here only if you really have to.

Reviews.Title: “nice place”
Reviews.Author: boltonUKMatt
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from nh city north and the hotel is a little far out but you have the shuttle bus that will take you into amsterdam free of charge. the rooms very good are nice and clean had a lovely comfortable sleep.The staff were very friendly and very helpful THE ONLY PROBLEM WITH THIS HOTEL IS IT IS A LITTLE FAR OUT AND ALTHOUGH YOU HAVE THE SHUTTLE BUS NEXT TIME I GO TO AMSTERDAM I WOULD HAVE A HOTEL IN THE CITY CENTRE

Reviews.Title: “Everything great but location”
Reviews.Author: ekmainaur
Reviews.Content: ROOM: Large enough, very clean, very well kept, clean bathrooms equipped with soap and shampoo, all modern facilities, refrigerator included, SLEEP: The mattress is firm, and the hotel is quiet at night, which is the main reason I booked it. Surely hotels in amsterdam central will be more noisy. SERVICE: Very polite and helpful. Although they could not easily find an extra comforter for me :). But they tried to get a blanket instead. LOCATION: This is the main issue here. I arrived in amsterdam central at 7:30 AM in the morning on a sunday, and the shuttle only runs from 10 in the morning that day. The staff at the NH central hotel (where the shuttle runs from) did not appear to be too friendly. So we took the ferry from amsterdam central station to the amsterdam noord region. The ferry takes about 10 minutes and is located right behind the central station. From the other side, we had to walk for about 15 minutes to the hotel. Although the walk is very nice, it is NOT the Amsterdam-ish walk you would expect. No canals, no coffee shops. The hotel is in the middle of a residential and industrial area. So, YOU DO NOT GET THE AMSTERDAM "FEEL" when living in this hotel. IMPORTANT TIPS: 1. I did not look for them, but looks like there are not easy to find convenience stored near the hotel. So get your grocery supplies from the main city before you go to sleep overnight 2. To get to the ferry, just walk to the opposite side of the central station, and you will find it. Or ask for information at the central station. 3. To avoid getting lost on the walk from the ferry to the hotel, DO NOT LOOK AT THE MAP ! It is confusing. Just keep following the road where the ferry lands. 4. They allowed us to check in at 1 PM, which was pretty good for a very busy easter weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfactory upgrade”
Reviews.Author: Silvertimetraveller
Reviews.Content: We were visiting Amsterdam for the 1st time and wanted a central hotel because we didn't want to spend long travel times getting to the city centre. We booked a package with these requirements in mind but the day prior to our departure we were contacted by the Travel Agent who offered us this hotel as an upgrade because there was construction noise at our previous selected hotel. What a fortunate decision we made in choosing this hotel. We were given a quite and lovely furnished room, the hotel provided a full cooked breakfast buffet which was great as my partner sufers from gluten intollerance, a continental breakfast is ruled out for us as most of whats on offer is poison to my partner, this solved all our problems. The walk from the hotel is not very far and is plesant, this is to the ferry (free) which is constantly crossing the canal and is no problem, the dock is just opposite the railway station. The shuttle bus is very convenient - when you arrive at Amsterdam Central Rly Station the bus is just across the road at the sister hotel NH City Amsterdam. This is a free service and runs every 10 - 15 mins and runs until 11.00pm weekdays and 03.00am Fri,Sat & Sun. The central hotels also offer the chance of a free toilet facilities as these are charged for throughout the city. Check-in and out were smooth and the staff couldnt have been more friendly and helpfull, they made our stay really great.. We would gladly use this hotel again without a second thought.

Reviews.Title: “Not too bad but a little far out..”
Reviews.Author: Whitewizard270870
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 friends stayed here from Fri 2nd until Sun 4th March 07. We booked it because the Victoria hotel in town was fully booked and this one looked quite nice & modern. We got a taxi from the airport to the hotel & were charged 60 euro's which was a rip off! (It cost only 35 to return) The check in staff were very good & spoke good English. The bar was good too but did not have Sky Sports on. Happy hour is every day between 1700 & 1900 which made it good value (50% off) otherwise it was expensive. We used the free shuttle bus quite a bit but the driver was very moody & refused to take us one time as he was going for his dinner. The timing sheet on the wall said they were every 15mins but that was a bit of an exaggeration and also gave you the impression that there was more than 1 bus which there wasn't. Taxi's into the centre ranged from 10 - 15 Euro's which isn't too bad but can mount up over the weekend. My biggest gripe was the room service - or rather lack of it! In the lifts, there were lists explaining what food & drink etc could be delivered 24/7 but both times we tried, we were told service had stopped as it was too late. Admittedly, it was 4.30am each time but 24/7 should mean just that. Breakfast was ok - Sausages were very undercooked and the toaster was rubbish but the bacon, scrambled eggs etc were fine. Overall, I would recommend this hotel for business travellers or couples exploring rather than the 'Lad's weekend' we were on as it's just too far away from the centre. ps.. We had a great meal in the Karma Sutra indian restaurant on Saturday night. Great food at a good price. You will not be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: paul&ali
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, the rooms were very clean, modern and quiet, the bed was really comfortable and the bathroom/ shower room was very clean and modern. The staff were ok, polite and helpful. The hotel operates a shuttle service in to the centre of town ( very nr central station) this proved to be a great service, only 8 minutes drive and departing every 15 min during the day, after midnight you had to ring ( from the waiting room at the barbizon nh hotel) however a mini bus was despatched straight away, and saved us from using a taxi ( can be expensive) at any time during our stay. alternatively a 10 minute walk to the ferry (free!), brings you nicely to the central station. overall excellent hotel, do not let its slightly out of the centre location put you off! it was a welcome break from the hustle and bustle of downtown amsterdam. My girlfriend had a few minor gripes, the ironing board did not stay up, however we did have a good iron in our room, fridge and all the usual comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Zh.Ou.
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Venere and got a rate of 408EUR for 4 nights. I was glad that we chose this hotel insead of others at city center. The area was quiet and there was a grocery store Alber Hein closeby. 10 minute walk to the river and take a free ferry you will be at central station and city center. But don't take your luggage walking this way. We did this by mistake and the road was rough and seemed endless. Bus 38 takes you from the ferry to outside of the hotel. The room was big and clean. The bedding was good. Compared to the stories I heard about other hotels and those hotels we saw at city center, I felt that we made a good choice. It has air conditioning, but not necessary during our stay in early September. We did not encounter large group of NWA crew like other people mentioned in their review. The staff was friendly. The internet was expensive, ~ 22 EUR per day. Did not try the breakfast. Save 4EUR if breakfast ticket is purchase one day in advance. There is a shuttle from this hotel to the other NH hotel near central station, but not close enough to central station if you have luggage. Bus 38 might be a better choice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: trinitario
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed 3 nights at the NH City North as part of a summer eurotrip. Here's the hotel rundown: Location: 10 mins outside city centre, but easily accessible by free shuttle to city centre (check timetable), or free ferry (10 min walk to pier, and free ferry 24hrs). Taxi to city centre is about 13 Euro. Prefer this location to one downtown as it's quieter, but still everything is easily accessible. Good food in various restaurants around the hotel. Front Desk Service: very efficient. Vincent and Kimberly are especially friendly and helpful. Look out for long lines of Northwest airlines staff checking in and out though. Rooms: Large, clean and comfortable. Television stations are mostly english, and there's also PPV. Bathrooms are large as well, with all the usual ammenities. Hydromassage shower head is a plus. Rooms lack a minibar, but there is 24hr room service. A/C does not get very cold even when on max, but the temp is still comfortable. Pillow menu is nice, and the beds are super comfortable. Extras such as complimentary short stories book give this hotel an edge. Overall: Standard 4star business hotel at the same price as 2 and 3 star hotels in amsterdam. Good service, very comfortable rooms. Would definitely stay here or in another NH again.

Reviews.Title: “Spend a little extra $ and Stay Here!”
Reviews.Author: travelgrrls
Reviews.Content: We would definitely stay here again. After staying in some run-down B&B's, this was a refreshing change. We were travelling on a budget, but wanted to spend just a little more money while in Amsterdam and enjoy a hotel. It was SO worth it. The non-smoking room was big, with a fridge, TV, safe, etc. Everything was dark wood, very clean and felt fancy for our usual budget accomodations! They even have the option to request a different types of pillows with different fillings! I felt like a wealthy business-woman, without paying a hefty price. We stayed for 5 nights and loved it. There were 2 ways to get to the city center: NH has a FREE shuttle that would run about every 15 minutes from noon to 10 pm to/from their other NH Barbazon Hotel that is just across from Central Station, or you could walk about 10 minutes to get to a FREE ferry that will take you across the IJ waterway (about a 3 minute ride) that gets you to Central Station. The ferry runs 24 hours a day. The only thing to remember, that we were never told, is that going from Central Station back in the direction of the hotel, there are 3 or 4 different ferries, so be sure you get on the one going straight across to Buiksloterweg - I think that's the name of the street. Sometimes we opted to do the walking down to the ferry, because one of the shuttle drivers had a little attitude and wasn't always the most polite guy, so when we didn't want to deal with it, we took the ferry. The only 2 bad things I can say about the hotel is that when we walked into the lobby and elevator area, it always smelled funny - like sulfur, sewer, cooking beans... we weren't sure what it was, and that when we wanted just a little butter with a butter knife for some bread we bought at the store, we could only do it through room service is it was an insane price for a little butter, so we just went without. The people at the front desk were always helpful... oh, and the bathrooms are wonderfully large and clean, and I enjoyed a relaxing bath every night. If we come to Amsterdam again, my partner and I are sure to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay if you know Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 75YEAROLDTRAVELER
Reviews.Content: My wife and our adult son stayed in two rooms for four nights checking in on March 16, 2006 and checking out on March 20, 2006. We were able to obtain a good package from Expedia flying directly from Boston via Northwest and staying at NH City North. This was our fourth trip to Amsterdam. Knowing Amsterdam, it was easy for us to take the train to Central Station, to transfer to the ferry to the north side and transfer to a bus to the hotel. Our total elapsed time was about 3/4 of an hour. Our only downside was that the Northwest crews stay at the hotel and are given priority at check in. They become upset if they have to wait 10 minutes although we had to wait 3 1/2 hours. This is a downside. The hotel is new and all of the rooms seem to be the same so that we had an extremely nice room even though we had a deal. Our room was far above basic with nice furnishings and it was "Clean". The area is an upscale residential area with adequate places to eat in the area. The hotel cafe was quite good and reasonable. Other than the check in downside the staff was very good and helpful. We enjoyed our stay and will stay there again. I think, probably, the NH chain is the best in Amsterdam but they miss the boat when they discrinate against their customers other than airline crews. I'm actually surprised as they otherwise seem to be "on the ball". All in all, however, it is my preferred place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy beds”
Reviews.Author: MegW
Reviews.Content: Good price, comfy bed, shuttle service was good and ran up to 230am which was handy. Drinks at bar expensive but this was to be expected. Probably would stay somewhere a bit more central next time, however if this hotel was remarkably cheaper would consider it. Friendly staff on shuttles and at reception.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay”
Reviews.Author: rmaBarcelona_Spain
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week-end and although not downtown, the location was really a peaceful, and all in all, it was a real good experience: comfortable bed, nice bath-room and helpful staff. As to the price, one of the best we managed to find in Amsterdam. In addition to the hotel shuttle, there's a peaceful 5-10min walk to a ferry which drops you just next to the Central Stations, where you may find virtualy all of the most important bus and tram lines. I would surely go back to this hotel whenever I am back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended !”
Reviews.Author: ip202659
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a weekend stay in Amsterdam. I chose NH City North based on positive experience with NH and the generally good reviews here. I was not disappointed. The hotel is located in the northern part of the city, on the other side of the river. However this is only a slight disadvantage. There is a shuttle service running from 10 am to 11pm (weekdays) and 2.30 am (weekends) which takes you to the square outside Amsterdam Centraal (in front of NH Barbizon Palace, to be more precise). Hotel facilities are very good, nice lobby, very nice English style bar and very good breakfast. You can book breakfast upon check in for a reduced price of 12 Euros, IMO it's worth it. Nice rooms, nothing luxurious, but perfectly OK. At 89 Eur this is very good value in Amsterdam, the only side is location but it relatively minor thanks to the great shuttle service. Amsterdam is a rather expensive city, namely in terms of accomodation, and IMO this is a very good deal.

Reviews.Title: “It's good, and has the best NH breakfast”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: NH Hotels seems to have a quit good idea of what guests wants. However, not all the NH's are into all the details. This one does: Nice reception, Nice room (with a BIG bed for one person, won't cost you more than just a simple bed) and a good breakfast. Only downside: don't wake me at 9AM.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Amsterdam hotel but ...”
Reviews.Author: rosetaylor
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 stayed at this lovely hotel Oct 14-15 2005. Room, staff etc etc excellent - location on Noord (residential side of Amsterdam). I'd recommend purchasing 12E breakfast voucher night before (costs 16E otherwise). Complimentary hotel bus takes you to free 1 min. ferry crossing to Centraal Station every 15 mins. Be warned though that many airline staff stay at this hotel and regard it as their own! We had a very nasty and rude encounter with one such American female whilst waiting our turn to return to the hotel from city centre. We reported this incident to the hotel security but heard nothing further. I'd definitely use the hotel again however ...

Reviews.Title: “Good value, although a little out of the centre”
Reviews.Author: goonermadness
Reviews.Content: This hotel was perfectly clean and well equipped, by European standards, with all the amenities that you would come to expect from a large chain of hotels, and has one of the lowest prices in Amsterdam at â‚¬89. The staff are polite, conscientious and multi-lingual. As the hotel has been built in the Noord, which has more space for development, the rooms are of a decent size and there are elevators unlike many hotels in the main part of the City. The only drawback is the location of the Hotel. It is not in the main body of Amsterdam but is located in the Noord, across the river. This means that from (Amsterdam) Centraal Rail Station you have to take the passenger ferry, located immediately outside (Centraal) on the river side, which is free of charge and goes 24hrs a day, every 6 minutes during the day. This ferry takes around 1 minute to cross and then it is a simple 10 minute walk straight along the road to the hotel. Basically, upon leaving the hotel you will arrive at Centraal, about 14 minutes later. Alternatively, you can take a bus (Numbers 34, 35, 91, 92, 94, 171, 172, 174) which stop in the road outside the hotel and take about 10 minutes from Centraal. Or you can take a taxi â€“ though, most are unsure as to where the hotel is â€“ at â‚¬15 for a 5 minute journey. The airport is a 15 minute train ride from Centraal â€“ at around â‚¬4.

HotelInfo.Name: NH Galaxy
HotelInfo.Address: Distelkade 21 | 1031 XP, Amsterdam 1031 XP, The Netherlands
